result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew D Smock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit for 49 days was granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge waived.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.   No contact with codefendants.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Andrew D Smock in court, in custody.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called to review defendant's letter to the court.
Review hearing on October 20, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Filed by the defendant requesting early release of his condition time.

Defendant Andrew D Smock in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Court orders the following:
- Sentence withheld.  Credit for 49 days if revoked.
- 2 years Probation. 
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Conditions of Probation:  Follow through with AODA treament/counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  No contact with codefendant.
Sentencing hearing on June 6, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Packet of information regarding presentence credit
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Andrew D Smock in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton.   Erik J Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed an Information.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.  Cases 14CF137 and 14CF419 dismissed and read into this matter and to 13CF1251,13CM2175 and 14CM412.  State requests adjourned sentencing date.  Court grants motion.  Court orders bail revoked.  Defendant to remain in custody pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 11:00 am.
